author: Gunjan Banerji
title: S&P Global Moves to Start Ratings Business in China
text:
S&P Global Inc., the financial-information giant, plans to build a stand-alone ratings business in China, bringing it a step closer to expanding its presence in one of the worldâ€™s biggest bond markets.
The company has notified the Chinese government of a plan to launch an independent credit-ratings firm in the country, an S&P spokesman said Wednesday. A trade deal last year opened up China to U.S. ratings firms. S&P is speaking with regulators on the entrance.
